text:
Fresh results from another basic income pilot. This one took place in San Antonio, Texas where 1,000 people got a $1,908 payment in Dec 2020, followed by 8 quarterly $400 payments between Apr 2021 and Jan 2023.

What happened?

Incomes from work went up.

That's a commonly observed impact BTW.

Time to bang the drum: the Gold Standard of menu pricing as taught by the Culinary Institute of America (and others) is:
33% labour
33% ingredients/packaging
23% capital costs
10% profit for owner
The reality is that owners are greedy not that staff are overpaid.

the discussion about "books that are kinda bad but they're fun to read anyway" is always fun because everybody has a different idea of what 'bad' means in a book and i think sometimes people think their quality measure is everybody's quality measure

Someone was surprised to learn that I yeet bugs out instead of *gently relocating* them.

I appreciate the gesture. But in the tropics, seeing bugs where they shouldn't be is an hourly—not weekly thing. You learn what can survive a yeet to save time.

In this thread I'm rating animal yeetability.

Don't do this.

You can get rid of Copilot *without* editing your registry.

You need a program called Geek Uninstaller. It's reputable. Check around.

Copilot relies on Edge. Without Edge, there is no Copilot.

Use Geek Uninstaller, choose Edge, right click, "Force Removal."

Easy to do or reverse.

Believe it or not, the practice is the point. And that whole process is muddied by how artists need to cater to the stunted tastes of companies who don’t give a shit about the process or the artist. And you need to eat! I get it! But you gotta take a step back and reconsider what your art is to you.

I want more people to consider what art means to them without the pressure to impress. How does your hand like to mark a curve? Where does it apply pressure and where does it release? What sorts of shapes are you drawn to? Do you hold your breath when you draw a delicate straight line?

I get that this misunderstanding is of apiece with capitalism. You want your portfolio to reflect a level of technical mastery to get you get hired to, like, draw a car for the background of a video game or some shit. I get that. That’s just craft. Everyone gets there with practice. BUT—

I feel so sad for this screencapped artist for a number of reasons, but I’m also sad for the state of arts education in general that so many *artists* seem to believe that the primary purpose of art is to be impressive. It’s not! You do art to learn it and learn yourself as an artist!

Oh hey I invented something for epoxy/resin art, hobbies, and industries that saves money and reduces plastic waste. 

It’s called The Utility Mat. It’s like a combo dump mold and work surface. It turns your excess mixed resin into useful tools instead of expensive blobs of trash.

artists! 

you can make your own media tab, here's how!

-log in to skyfeed.app
-click "feed builder"
-copy the settings below, make an art tag/keyword
-add an icon and a name/description, copy that link.

now you can add that link in your bio, and clicking it will show ONLY your tagged art!

#Arachtober 8th is for learning to draw spiders! Why? 10 & 8 are all you need!
1️⃣Draw an 8. This is the spider's body: head+abdomen
2️Draw 10 limbs (8 longer legs + 2 pedipalps ("arms") ALL attached to the head!
Ta-da! You've now drawn a more accurate spider than many Spider-Man logos! #SciArt

The Ocelot Knight is from an order who go and get late magical books from an arcane library.

Magic users often become... 'possessive' of magical books they've borrowed, so it's quite militant returns policy.

Concept that I got part way through turning into a character design.
